prior_works.title: Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models
prior_works.authors: Jonathan Ho, Ajay Jain, Pieter Abbeel
prior_works.role: Foundational diffusion backbone for generative modeling
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Time Weaver builds on the DDPM formulation for forward noising and reverse denoising, adapting this backbone to multivariate time series with metadata-aware conditioning.

prior_works.title: Classifier-Free Diffusion Guidance
prior_works.role: Generic conditional guidance mechanism for diffusion models
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Time Weaver leverages and extends classifier-free guidance to incorporate heterogeneous metadata (categorical, continuous, and time-varying) to control conditional consistency during time-series generation.

prior_works.title: CSDI: Conditional Score-based Diffusion Models for Imputation of Missing Values in Time-Series
prior_works.role: Conditional diffusion on time series with temporal conditioning
prior_works.relationship_sentence: CSDI’s approach to injecting time-varying conditioning signals into score-based diffusion informs Time Weaver’s design for handling exogenous, temporally evolving metadata, though Time Weaver targets full conditional generation rather than imputation.

prior_works.title: Autoregressive Denoising Diffusion Models for Multivariate Probabilistic Time Series Forecasting (TimeGrad)
prior_works.role: Diffusion applied to temporal dependencies and sequential prediction
prior_works.relationship_sentence: TimeGrad demonstrates how diffusion can capture temporal dynamics in multivariate sequences, which Time Weaver adapts to conditional generation with metadata rather than purely forecasting.

prior_works.title: Real-valued (Medical) Time Series Generation with Recurrent Conditional GANs
prior_works.authors: Cristóbal Esteban, Stephanie L. Hyland, Gunnar Rätsch
prior_works.role: Early conditional time-series generation with side information
prior_works.relationship_sentence: RCGAN established the conditional TS generation setup using exogenous labels, a problem formulation that Time Weaver generalizes to richer, heterogeneous metadata and a diffusion-based generator.

prior_works.title: TimeGAN: Generating Time Series via Generative Adversarial Networks
prior_works.authors: Jinsung Yoon, Daniel Jarrett, Mihaela van der Schaar
prior_works.role: Baseline for TS generation and evaluation protocols
prior_works.relationship_sentence: TimeGAN popularized benchmarks and metrics like TSTR for TS generation, against which Time Weaver positions itself and critiques naive metric transfers from images by emphasizing conditional fidelity.

prior_works.title: TabDDPM: Modelling Tabular Data with Diffusion Models
prior_works.role: Handling mixed continuous/categorical variables in diffusion
prior_works.relationship_sentence: TabDDPM’s techniques for representing and denoising heterogeneous attributes inspire Time Weaver’s treatment of categorical and continuous metadata in a unified conditional diffusion framework.

synthesis_narrative:
Time Weaver’s core contribution—conditional diffusion-based generation of time series using heterogeneous metadata—sits at the confluence of diffusion modeling, temporal conditioning, and mixed-type data handling. The diffusion backbone and training objective come directly from Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models, while Classifier-Free Diffusion Guidance provides the practical, scalable mechanism for conditioning that Time Weaver adapts to control generation with categorical, continuous, and time-varying metadata. Bringing diffusion into the temporal domain, TimeGrad showed how denoising steps can capture sequential dependencies, and CSDI demonstrated effective injection of time-varying conditioning signals in score-based models; Time Weaver leverages these insights but targets full conditional synthesis rather than forecasting or imputation.
Earlier conditional time-series generators such as RCGAN and TimeGAN shaped the problem setup—conditioning on exogenous information and evaluating synthetic realism and utility. They also highlighted the limitations of GAN-based approaches in maintaining long-horizon dynamics and conditional consistency, motivating Time Weaver’s move to diffusion and its critique of naive metric transfers (e.g., image-style FID). Finally, TabDDPM’s strategies for diffusion over mixed continuous/categorical variables inform Time Weaver’s representation and denoising of heterogeneous metadata. Together, these works provide the generative scaffolding, conditioning mechanisms, temporal modeling principles, and mixed-type handling that Time Weaver unifies to deliver metadata-aware, conditionally faithful time-series synthesis and improved evaluation suited to the temporal setting.
